**As An Operations Application Manager, You Will** 



* Support the roll-out of Autodesk Construction Cloud and Revit, providing handson expertise and advice to ensure smooth adoption.
* Act as an application advisor, assisting the Project Manager with implementation strategies and best practices.
* Establish and lead application management forums for ACC and Revit, facilitating collaboration and continuous improvement.
* Oversee and optimize the use of Monday.com, Lumion, and Oculo.
* Provide and coordinate second line support, training, and documentation for key applications.
* Collaborate with internal teams such as our ERP Team and business process owners to improve processes, systems and data quality. And if you know anything about Business Central it’s a plus!
* Coordinate, align and communicate around software updates, troubleshoot issues, and ensure data integrity.
* Manage licenses and our key vendors that support our key operational tools.



  





**The Ideal Candidate Has** 



* A proven experience with ACC and Revit or similar collaboration and 3D design tools.
* Familiarity with Monday.com, Lumion, and Oculo or similar tools is a plus.
* Experience in supporting business system roll-outs and working closely with project teams to ensure adoption of the suite according to group and local processes.
* Experience in designing, implementing and drive application management:
* Outline and agree on business priorities within applications.
* Establish and drive super user communities.
* Establish support organizations/processes (where super users are 1st line of support).
* Create and maintain application and end-user documentation.
* Manage vendors and licenses.
* Experience from acting as second line support.
* Experience from working/collaborating with ERP teams on operations processes.
* But most importantly the right attitude and willingness to learn quickly, to connect the dots even if they are far apart!



  





 If this sounds like a role for you, don’t hesitate to reach out! We are reviewing applications on an ongoing basis.

title: Head of Operations
description:
**Introducing evroc**
 At evroc, we are building a secure, sovereign, and sustainable hyperscale cloud to reimagine the digital future of Europe. By joining our company, you have an exciting opportunity to contribute to the development of next-generation cloud services. We are seeking intellectually curious and highly motivated team members who are ready to embrace the thrilling challenge of building the first European-owned hyperscale cloud.
   

  

**Location:** 
 London or Stockholm
   

  

**Job type:** 
 Permanent position
   

  

**Join the Pioneers**
 At the outset of our journey, we're not just building software; we're laying the groundwork for our technology solutions and how we’ll operate as an engineering team. As we expand, the organisation of our teams and the specialisation into product areas hinge on these formative decisions. Coming on board now means you're not just coding - you're contributing directly to how we set ourselves up for success, how we tackle challenges, and how we define our engineering culture. This isn’t just a job; it's a chance to leave an indelible mark on our technology, teams, culture, and ethos.
   

  

**What You'll Tackle**
* Direct global operations teams across multiple data centres and regions.
* Establish and optimize support infrastructure, SLAs, and escalation protocols.
* Develop metrics and KPIs to measure operational performance and customer satisfaction.
* Drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance service reliability and efficiency.
* Manage large-scale incident response and problem resolution processes.
* Build and lead technical support teams across multiple tiers.
* Collaborate with engineering on product improvements based on operational insights.
* Establish standardized operating procedures and playbooks.
* Lead crisis management during major service disruptions.


**Skills We Value**
* 10+ years of experience in technical operations management, preferably in cloud services.
* Proven leadership experience managing large, distributed technical teams.
* Strong understanding of cloud infrastructure, virtualization, and networking.
* Track record implementing automation and operational efficiency improvements.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
* Experience with incident management and problem resolution at scale.
* Knowledge of compliance requirements for cloud services.
* MBA or technical degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
* Experience with data analytics and performance measurement systems.


 We offer a competitive salary and an equity package to attract the best. Whether it’s the cosmopolitan allure of London, the vibrant Stockholm, or the Mediterranean charm of Sophia Antipolis, you’re poised for an inspiring work environment and a captivating local culture!
   

  

 At evroc, diversity is our strength. We champion an inclusive environment where every background - ethnicity, age, gender identity, beliefs, and culture - is celebrated.
   

  

 Applicants must possess a valid work permit.

title: Energy Projects Manager, Infrastructure Energy Team
description:
**Description**
 This position is available in: Stockholm, Dublin, London. Please submit your CV in Eng.
   

  

 As part of AWS’ EMEA Energy & Water team, the AWS Infrastructure Energy Team (IET) for Europe, Middle East and Africa (EMEA) is looking for a results-oriented individual to join in the role of Energy Projects Manager. This role owns the end-to-end power scaling strategy for a number of countries within the EMEA footprint. The role’s scope extends to analyzing, developing and implementing strategies on how we interconnect our data centers and how we can scale our business across the power grids on which we depend. The ultimate deliverable of the role is to ensure that access to secure, resilient and scalable power is maintained across the 2-3 countries you will have responsibility for so as not to constrain AWS business growth for our customers.
   

  

 With a proven track record in the power/energy sector, complemented by a robust project management skillset, you will own the origination and contracting of power capacity in partnership with regional experts. This will see you look round corners in anticipation of risks and barriers to growth, deep diving the quality of the power system and the underpinning generation and developing tactical solutions and strategic proposals to navigate constraints in terms of access to power. By delivering on the strategies you develop, you will enable scalable future growth to support the expansion of AWS Cloud, enabling our customers to innovate faster.
   

  

 In conjunction with partner teams, the successful candidate will cultivate business and technical relationships with a variety of stakeholders, including grid and electricity utilities, regulators and policymakers to ensure that power can be secured in a timely and economic manner to support AWS’s EMEA infrastructure expansion.
   

  

 AWS Infrastructure Services (AIS)
   

  

 AWS Infrastructure Services owns the design, planning, delivery, and operation of all AWS global infrastructure. In other words, we’re the people who keep the cloud running. We support all AWS data centers and all of the servers, storage, networking, power, and cooling equipment that ensure our customers have continual access to the innovation they rely on. We work on the most challenging problems, with thousands of variables impacting the supply chain — and we’re looking for talented people who want to help.
   

  

 You’ll join a diverse team of software, hardware, and network engineers, supply chain specialists, security experts, operations managers, and other vital roles. You’ll collaborate with people across AWS to help us deliver the highest standards for safety and security while providing seemingly infinite capacity at the lowest possible cost for our customers. And you’ll experience an inclusive culture that welcomes bold ideas and empowers you to own them to completion.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

* You will work with real estate and planning teams, lead the development and execution of a comprehensive power growth strategy for AWS’s EMEA data centers for new and existing regions
* You will prospect for, originate and contract the power capacity needed to support the delivery of data centers
* You will identify risks in the delivery and operation of power grids and identify appropriate mitigations in collaboration with partner teams
* You will identify and develop cost saving projects and initiatives related to grid and network infrastructure
* You will collaborate with electricity utilities and other external stakeholders to develop strategies that support AWS’s expansion in EMEA
* You will work with AWS’s Public Policy team to develop policies and guidelines that enable broader AWS strategies and objectives


 A day in the life
   

  

* Leverages project management skills to manage both internal business partners and energy stakeholders
* Drives tactical execution of power contracts and initiatives
* Establishes and grows business and technical relationships, managing the day-to-day interactions with these partners
* Meeting the energy team objectives to support AWS’s EMEA infrastructure expansion


**About The Team**
 ABOUT THE TEAM
   

  

 The Infrastructure Energy team is currently a team of 13, with members of the team currently based in Dublin (Ireland), London (England), Madrid (Spain), Dubai (UAE) and Frankfurt (Germany). The team is responsible for originating, contracting and delivering reliable power connections to our DCs across EMEA. The work of the team is divided across a team of Energy Project Managers (EPMs) and Grid Delivery Managers (GDMs), supported by business analysts. The EPMs prospect for, originate and secure the power needed for AWS’s fleet of data centres while the GDMs lead the delivery of large-scale HV & MV infrastructure connections to our data centres. Finding reliable, scalable, sustainable power is one of the big challenges facing AWS today and into the future. The Infrastructure Energy team is key to meeting this challenge and enabling scalable future growth to support the expansion of AWS Cloud and our customers to innovate faster.
   

  

**About Aws**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship and Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Bachelor's Degree in Electrical or Power Engineering or other relevant technical field or equivalent professional or technical qualification
* 7-10+ years delivery track record in the electric utility/energy industry in an engineering, project or technical role including, but not limited to, deep understanding of the grid application process, grid access rules and electricity grids; understanding of the underlying policy and regulatory environment and extensive project management experience
* Ability to manage multiple simultaneous projects requiring frequent communication, organization, time management and problem-solving skills
* Proven track record for cultivating strong relationships with key clients and external stakeholders that have resulted in high customer satisfaction
* Working proficiency in the Swedish and English languages, both written and spoken


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Master’s Degree in relevant discipline (MBA/MS)
* Project Management Professional (PMP) or equivalent
* Experience designing, developing & delivering HV / MV electric infrastructure
* Experience of IT infrastructure, data centres and cloud services
* Ability to converse in German, French or Italian is advantageous
* Experience working on energy policy initiatives


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - Amazon Data Services Sweden AB - C95
   

  

 Job ID: A2927812

title: (Senior) IT Consultant - Enterprise Solutions | BCG Platinion
description:
Who We Are
   

  

 Do you want to turn the challenges of digitalization into the solutions of the future? Join BCG Platinion in tackling the core IT issues of leading global companies. Deploy customized platforms, architectures, strategies, and organizations to leverage the digital potential of our customers and drive true innovation, with state-of-the-art tools such as cloud computing, AI, blockchain, microservices, and containerization. Add your individual strengths to our unique team, always there to support you. Together with Boston Consulting Group and our clients, we turn digital visions into reality.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

 For our Nordic offices (Stockholm, Oslo, Helsinki and Copenhagen), we are looking for (Senior) IT Consultants for our Enterprise Solutions chapter! About The Job At BCG Platinion, we provide sound advice on all relevant IT issues. In particular, the migration to the SAP S/4HANA solution against the background of the planned mainstream maintenance presents our customers with special challenges. The typical questions our customers have range from justification and business benefits of the SAP S/4 HANA Transition to optimized roadmaps taking into account the implications on overall architecture and also alternative solutions and platforms. To serve our customers even better, we would like to strengthen our Enterprise Solutions team. You work together with colleagues from Platinion and/or the Boston Consulting Group on local and international customer projects. Together with our customers, you actively develop superior, business value driven ERP and application architecture strategies, concepts and roadmaps and apply your sound technical and process-related understanding. Last but not least, you enjoy your work and embody the 'BCG Platinion Spirit' with your hands-on manner.
   

  

 What You'll Bring
   

  

**This Is How You Make a Difference**
* An above-average degree in computer science, business informatics, business administration or a related field
* At least 3 years of relevant experience in the context of strategic ERP/CRM/SCM projects
* Technical knowledge along typical end-to-end processes relevant in the enterprise solutions context (Purchase-2-Pay, Order-2-Cash, Lead-2-Quote, Record-2-Report, Hire-2-Retire etc.)
* General knowledge of wider portfolio of industry specific solutions, solution add-on’s and analytical tools Exceptional analytical and conceptual skills
* Fluent in one Nordic Language and English (written and spoken)
* Strong client and result orientation
* Team spirit, communication and presentation skills as well as intellectual agility
* Ability to align individuals and organizations to a common goal


 Who You'll Work With
   

  

**Shape The World Of Tomorrow**
* Supporting the client in ERP/CRM/SCM projects along the entire supply chain: from requirements analysis to solution design/technical concept, implementation, testing, training and rollout
* Design / definition of specific ERP/CRM/SCM solutions along the value chain of our clients and the required functional modules Introduction of 'best practices' in the evaluation, specification and implementation of user requirements, in particular with a view to reducing one-off and maintenance costs
* Technical management of implementation and migration projects or in specific domains Requirements management within the scope of enterprise solutions projects, incl. the management of specialist concept workshops with business process managers
* Control and prototyping of customizing of ERP/CRM/SCM solutions Support in the sale of large Enterprise Solutions projects by providing technical and methodological expertise
* Further development of the content of the enterprise solutions topics at BCG Platinion, e.g., through participation in conferences, in the creation of a training catalog or with technical articles


 Additional info
   

  

**How You Can Grow With Us**
 We guarantee constant development incentives in an open and rewarding work environment! Together with a dedicated team of talented colleagues, you get to work on new challenges every day. Individual training offers and a culture of open feedback will provide the framework needed to explore and perfect personal strengths. Our modern structures allow focusing on the essence of our work - with easy travel booking, an excellent back-office support and comprehensive Knowledge Center. With our regular office Fridays and legendary events, we nurture a strong and close team network beyond our case work.
   

  

**Become a Part Of Our Team**
 Apply over our online portal now, with your CV, a relevant project list, and all pertinent references.
   

  

*BCG Platinion is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to national origin, color, age, sex, gender identity / expression, sexual orientation, religion, disability or any other protected characteristic.*
*#BCGPlatinion*
 Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.
   

  

 BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

title: Linux Drifttekniker till företag i försvarssektorn
description:
Är du en erfaren Linux tekniker med ett starkt säkerhetstänk och en passion för systemförvaltning, serverdrift och automatisering? Vill du vara en del av ett team som arbetar med att skapa säkra och effektiva IT-lösningar inom en högteknologisk miljö? Då kan detta vara rätt utmaning för dig!
   

  

 Som konsult på Centric får du en trygg anställning och samlar på dig värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Din konsultchef stöttar dig i din utveckling där du hela tiden fyller på med nya erfarenheter och kunskaper. En utmärkt möjlighet att bygga vidare på sin karriär.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 
 I rollen som Linux Drifttekniker blir du en nyckelspelare i teamet som ansvarar för förvaltning och vidareutveckling av tekniska tjänster till kundens verksamhet. Ditt arbete kommer att säkerställa tillgängligheten av system och digitala tjänster, vilket ställer höga krav på säkerhet, stabilitet och noggrannhet. Du kommer också att ha en central roll i leverans- och supportflödet av IT-tjänster.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
* Standardisera, effektivisera och automatisera arbetssätt och system
* Delta i projekt kopplade till teknikplattformen
* Arbeta inom drift- och supportteamet med felsökning och installationer
* Hantera patchning och uppgraderingar av servermiljön
* Säkerställa efterlevnad av gällande säkerhetskrav
* Aktivt delta i teknikförbättringsarbete


**Din profil och kvalifikationer** 
 Vi söker dig med ett starkt teknikintresse och gedigen erfarenhet inom Linux-området. Du har arbetat i större driftsmiljöer och hanterat olika varianter av operativsystem. Du är noggrann, serviceinriktad och trivs med att arbeta i team.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen som Linux Drifttekniker ser vi att du har:**
* Minst 4–8 års erfarenhet inom LINUX med fokus på serverdrift
* Goda kunskaper i scriptspråk som Bash eller Python
* Säkerhetstänk kring automatiserad konfigurationsstyrning
* Stort tekniskt intresse och förmåga att hålla dig uppdaterad inom området
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


**Meriterande Erfarenheter**
* Kunskap om Red Hat, SUSE Manager eller liknande verktyg
* Erfarenhet av Ansible, Docker och Kubernetes
* Kunskap inom systemhärdning


**Övrig information**
* Resor inom Sverige förekommer – B-körkort är önskvärt
* Befattningen kräver godkänd säkerhetsprövning enligt gällande bestämmelser


 Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan det, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder** 
 På Centric får du de verktyg du behöver för att nå dina mål. Vi erbjuder alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Vi tycker nämligen att våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas. Därför erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan, där vi bekostar såväl studiematerial som själva certifieringarna. Under din utveckling kommer vi matcha din kompetens mot rätt uppdrag i takt med att du avancerar. Vi genomför regelbundet spännande aktiviteter där du som konsult får möjlighet att träffa och umgås med dina kollegor under roliga och avslappnande former.
   

  

 Mer om oss
   

  

 Centric är ett IT-företag med 380 anställda, med kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö och Linköping. Vi specialiserar oss på uthyrning av generalister och förmedling av specialister samt erbjuder outsourcing och systemlösningar inom retail. Vi är medlem i Almega Kompetensföretagen och följer deras tecknade kollektivavtal med Unionen.

title: Azure Application Modernization Architect
company_industry: Computer and Network Security and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
**About The Role**
**Location** 
 Amsterdam, Netherlands
   

  

 At Atos, we’re seeking an Azure Application Modernization Architect to help our clients navigate their digital transformation journeys. You’ll collaborate with clients to assess legacy applications and craft innovative modernization strategies using the latest Azure technologies. This is your chance to make a significant impact by driving the re-platforming and modernization of complex enterprise applications to the cloud, ensuring scalability and efficiency.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Collaborate with clients to evaluate their legacy applications and define a strategic path for modernization.
* Architect and design solutions using Azure App Services, AKS, Logic Apps, and API Management to create high-performance cloud-native applications.
* Support sales and presales teams by providing technical expertise during client discussions and responses to RFPs.
* Develop proof-of-concept (PoC) solutions to demonstrate the potential and capabilities of modernized applications.
* Ensure seamless integration of modernized applications with existing systems, delivering solutions that meet business needs.
* Provide guidance on re-platforming, refactoring, and rebuilding legacy applications to make them future-ready on Azure.
* Stay updated on the latest modernization frameworks and cloud-native development practices, ensuring your solutions are at the forefront of technology.


**What We’re Looking For**
* 8+ years of experience in IT, with at least 4+ years in application modernization and Azure technologies.
* Proven experience with Azure cloud-native services and deep knowledge of DevOps practices.
* Hands-on expertise in containerization using Docker and orchestration with Kubernetes.
* Relevant certifications such as DevOps Engineer Expert or Azure Solutions Architect Expert are a plus.
* Dutch language skills are preferred but not mandatory.
* Strong leadership and communication skills with the ability to guide teams and influence key stakeholders.


**What Atos Offers You**
 At Atos, we believe in empowering our employees to thrive. We offer an inspiring environment where you’ll have opportunities to grow both professionally and personally. We provide the tools, training, and opportunities you need to continue developing your skills and expertise in an ever-evolving industry. The benefits we offer include
   

  

* A competitive salary and attractive benefits (including a year-end bonus and pension plan).
* A flexible working environment with opportunities to balance your work and personal life—whether through flexible hours or part-time arrangements.
* 29 vacation days per year to help you recharge.
* A mobility budget to suit your needs.
* The chance to work on exciting projects with prestigious clients, developing innovative solutions and furthering your expertise.
* International career growth opportunities within the Atos network, allowing you to expand your professional horizons.
* Access to extensive training and development programs, helping you stay at the forefront of the latest cloud technologies.
* A collaborative and inclusive culture where diversity is celebrated, and innovation thrives through teamwork.


**Why Join Us?**
 At Atos, you’ll be part of a global leader in digital transformation, shaping the future of cloud technology. We foster a diverse, inclusive, and innovative environment where your ideas and contributions are valued. Join us and make a lasting impact, creating solutions that shape the future of business.
   

  

 If you're ready to take on exciting challenges, expand your career, and work with cutting-edge technologies, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today and be part of Atos!

title: Quantitative Researcher — Wholesale Energy Markets
description:
**⚡️ What We Do**
 Swiftly gaining ground as Sweden’s industry leader in battery storage and expanding rapidly in selected European markets, Flower is on a mission to enable the energy system of tomorrow.
   

  

 With an industry-leading AI-powered platform at its core, our service includes stabilizing the energy system by enhancing predictability and flexibility for both energy producers and consumers. By combining pioneering technology with a portfolio of flexible energy assets, we break new ground towards a fossil-free energy system, allowing clean energy to power society.
   

  

**🌟Who We Are**
 Tech company at heart – purpose in our DNA. Flower consists of a diverse group of innovative individuals with a strong desire to improve the state of the world.
   

  

 At Flower, we believe trust, collaboration and diversity are essential to not only create an inclusive work environment, but also drive career growth. By embracing varying perspectives, we allow creativity and progress to flourish.
   

  

 To accelerate towards our goal of becoming the pioneering force powering the energy system of tomorrow, we are now looking for a passionate and skilled Quantitative Researcher.
   

  

**👩‍💻 About The Role**
 As a Quantitative Researcher, you will collaborate with a team to design and develop trading execution algorithms for the energy markets. You will contribute to our strategic bidding and risk management in short-term energy markets like day-ahead or intraday auctions, helping prevent imbalances and optimizing our energy allocation. This includes placing orders in the intraday continuous market. You will also perform quantitative analyses on large datasets, guide the integration of new data sources into our strategies, and ensure our solutions align with regulatory standards.
   

  

 You will be part of our Trading domain, working alongside market experts, data scientists, engineers, and developers. Your collaboration with stakeholders both within and outside of Trading will play a key role in Flower’s expansion.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Work with a team to design and develop trading execution algorithms for the energy markets.
* Leverage quantitative methods and data science techniques to conduct energy market analyses.
* Analyze large datasets and real-time market data.
* Integrate risk management principles into your solutions.
* Ensure compliance with regulatory standards in the energy trading sector.
* Stay up to date on market trends, new regulations, and emerging technologies in the energy trading sector.


**Who You Are**
* Ideally, you have 3+ years of experience designing and building algorithmic trading models in the energy or financial sector, but we value strong quantitative skills and a willingness to learn.
* Experience developing algorithmic trading strategies such as market making, arbitrage, hedging, or momentum trading.
* Ability to work with and analyze large and real-time datasets.
* Strong statistical mindset with experience applying probability and statistics to optimize algorithms.
* Experience in risk management and integrating risk into algorithmic strategies.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and a proactive, impact-driven mindset.
* Strong communication skills, with the ability to convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* Experience solving optimization problems is a plus.


**📍 Location**
 Our beautiful office is located in the heart of Södermalm just a short walk from Slussen subway station. We encourage in-office collaboration but support a hybrid work model.
   

  

**✉️ Apply**
 Our corporate language is English, as we have over 20 nationalities in the office. We therefore appreciate it if you could submit your CV in English.
   

  

 Throughout the recruitment process you will meet with the People & Talent Partner, Squad Head, Data Scientists and our CEO.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

*We kindly but firmly decline any engagement in recruitment assistance for our hiring processes. This includes partnership offers or the sale of recruitment tools.*

title: Client Executive - Sales Graduate Program
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Research Services
description:
Dassault Systèmes, the 3DEXPERIENCE Company, provides businesses and people with virtual universes to imagine sustainable innovations. Its 3DEXPERIENCE platform leverages the Company’s world-leading 3D software applications to transform the way products are designed, produced, and supported. With its online architecture, the 3DEXPERIENCE environment helps businesses to test and evaluate — anywhere in the development lifecycle of a product or service — the eventual experience they will deliver to their customers. In short, 3DEXPERIENCE powers the next-generation capabilities that drive today’s Experience Economy.
   

  

 At Dassault Systèmes EURONORTH, we are delighted to announce the launch of the 2025 Sales Associate Graduate Program, a key development program for talent of the future in sales & business roles.
   

  

**Start date:** 
 Full Time from 1st September 2025
   

  

**Length:** 
 Permanent (initial 12 months will align to our Graduate Program)
   

  

**Location: Stockholm/Gothenburg**
**Program Overview:** 
 Join experienced project teams, receive guidance from senior staff and demonstrate your skills and curiosity on customer-facing projects. Learn about our core products and industrial applications, and develop your skills in technical, business, and leadership areas. Move into the direct sales team and continue your career with us.
   

  

**Role Description & Responsibilities**
* Work closely with the senior Client Executive supporting with strategic sales development and account management
* Deliver market development plans for strategic Transportation & Mobility account with the contribution of Dassault Systèmes’ ecosystem and consistent with our sales process
* Conduct qualifying conversations with prospects in a consultative approach by phone to determine business needs, budget, and timeline
* Use multiple tactics to engage with new accounts: social selling, phone, email and sales campaigns/webinars. Respond to inbound inquiries generated by website content and marketing campaigns.
* Support execution of Account Based Marketing campaigns as part of a cross-functional team
* Develop and maintain knowledge of Dassault Systèmes’ solutions, services, industries and workflows by leverage internal and external training resources


**Qualifications**
* We are seeking enthusiastic, proactive and highly motivated candidates with a Master’s degree in Engineering, Business, Economics or similar
* Able to assimilate information quickly, take on specific tasks with focus and motivation while working in a dynamic team environment and providing a high level of communication to key stakeholders
* Able to work as part of a team and be confident questioning the current thinking
* Comfortable learning new technologies and approaches
* Confident in presenting and holding meetings, and working directly in a customer environment
* Well-organised and structured
* Self-motivated, flexible and adaptable
* Keen to find innovative ways to apply our software solutions to tackle some of the world’s greatest sustainability challenges


**What’s In It For You?**
* An international and diverse working environment in a collaborative team
* Receive intense training, development and support
* Use the scheme as a pathway to more responsible roles within the organization
* Make connections throughout the organisation that will assist you after completion of the program
* Provide an excellent platform to start your career
* Make use of the strong support hub provided including buddies, mentors and a sponsor


 Interested? Click on "Apply" to upload your application documents.
   

  

**Diversity statement**
 As a game-changer in sustainable technology and innovation, Dassault Systèmes is striving to build more inclusive and diverse teams across the globe. We believe that our people are our number one asset and we want all employees to feel empowered to bring their whole selves to work every day. It is our goal that our people feel a sense of pride and a passion for belonging. As a company leading change, it’s our responsibility to foster opportunities for all people to participate in a harmonized Workforce of the Future.

title: Integrationsutvecklare/Systemutvecklare
description:
**Techster Solutions** 
 befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst
 **5+** 
 års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.
   

  

 Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.
   

  

**Rollbeskrivning**
**Vi söker nu efter en Integrationsutvecklare/Systemutvecklare till vår kund inom offentlig sektor.**
**Rollen Som Systemutvecklare/integrationsutvecklare Innebär Bl.a. Att**
* Implementera integrationsflöden i Apache Camel på Kubernetes plattform
* Dokumentera design och systemlösningar
* Arbeta med XML och konvertering mellan olika XML format
* Deltagande i förvaltningsarbete där t.ex. felsökning, rättning och testning av nya och befintliga integrationer, samt delta i teamets utveckling
* Arbete med migrering av integrationer till den nya integrationsplattformen
* Deltagande i projekt


**Obligatoriska krav**
**Utbildning**
* Högskole/universitetsutbildning omfattande minst 120p/180hp inom IT, såsom Systemvetenskap eller datavetenskap, eller motsvarande kunskaper förvärvade genom minst 5 års erfarenhet genom arbete inom IT branschen.


**Kompetens Och Erfarenhet**
* Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet från systemutveckling.
* Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av applikationsutveckling som bygger på mikroservicearkitektur och container-teknik.
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av utveckling med Java
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet från att ha arbetat med system- och integrationsutveckling där alla nedanstående teknologier har ingått:
* XML/XSLT
* JMS
* Web service (SOAP/REST)
* Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet från systemutveckling mot Apache Camel


**Mervärdeskrav**
* Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet från att ha arbetat med systemintegration inom energibranschen
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet från att ha arbetat med Oracle SOA Suite och Oracle WebLogic
* Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet från arbete med mikrotjänster baserat på Spring/Spring boot


**Placeringsort:** 
 Sundbyberg
   

  

**Omfattning:** 
 Heltid på plats i kundens lokaler, med viss möjlighet till distansarbete.
   

  

**Start:** 
 2025-05-26
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Tror du att du är
 **Techster Solutions** 
 nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Arbetsplats och kultur
   

  

 Vi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.
   

  

 Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

title: SubRegional Head/Network Lead Supply Chain (Subregion North-West)
company_industry: Pharmaceutical Manufacturing, Biotechnology Research, and Medical Equipment Manufacturing
description:
Roche fosters diversity, equity and inclusion, representing the communities we serve. When dealing with healthcare on a global scale, diversity is an essential ingredient to success. We believe that inclusion is key to understanding people’s varied healthcare needs. Together, we embrace individuality and share a passion for exceptional care. Join Roche, where every voice matters.
   

  

 The Position
   

  

 A healthier future. It’s what drives us to innovate. To continuously advance science and ensure everyone has access to the healthcare they need today and for generations to come. Creating a world where we all have more time with the people we love. That’s what makes us Roche.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
 The Network Lead is leading the subregional Supply Chain and oversees supply chain strategy and operations to ensure sub regional and global alignment. You provide ongoing guidance, coaching and consultation to affiliate supply chain functions and teams, including cascading global and regional supply chain strategies, metrics, systems, standards and other tools and resources. You are a strategic thinker with an excellent business acumen who can leverage this deep understanding of Supply Chain to guide decision-making, provide analytical insight and business judgment to support strategic and tactical initiatives across the network.
   

  

 Supply Chain as a competitive edge striving for an extraordinary customer experience is the key principle.
   

  

 Strategy & Innovation:
   

  

* Enable the supply chain leads across the network to deliver on financials and strategy and responsible for delivering on Supply Chain KPIs for the Network e.g. Inventories, write offs and distribution costs
* Represent the Sub-Region at the EMEA-Latam SC Leadership Team
* Accountable to develop the supply chain strategy for the network in close collaboration with Regional/Global supply chain and other networks and represent the Sub-Region at the EMEA-Latam SC Leadership Team
* Accountable for leading the implementation and delivering the EMEA LATAM strategic focus areas in the network
* Accountable and responsible for the affiliates’ needs and fuel the EMEA LATAM strategic pipeline to boost Supply Chain as a competitive edge
* Identify opportunities and needs within the network. Drive the network’s talent pipeline to fuel the regional talent pool and development. Coach and provide feedback to our Affiliates SC Managers aimed at people growth and development
* Lead and own key capabilities across the network to contribute to the success of the EMEA-LATAM strategic priorities


 Operations:
   

  

* Ensure operational excellence and sustainability, lead and drive the implementation of continuous improvement within the network and across the EMEA LATAM Supply Chain (Order Management, Demand & Supply Planning, Warehousing & Distribution, etc.)
* Identify and co-lead the design and implementation of Supply Chain related improvements within the EMEA LATAM SC framework to elevate customer experience
* Act as the link for the region to key stakeholders e.g. Global Supply Chain, EMEA LATAM, Business Process Management, etc. and programs to deliver a superior customer experience, whilst continuously optimizing the operation and guaranteeing business continuity
* Responsible for delivering key performance deliverables such as inventory levels, distribution costs, write offs are achieved within the network


**Who you are:**
 To be successful in this application, the new sub-region Supply Chain Network Lead will have a minimum 10 years of Supply Chain experience, with 5-8 years experience in a leadership position; you bring a University Degree/MBA and a proven record of ensuring Supply Chain governance and a strong network with the internal and external Supply Chain communities.
   

  

 Furthermore you will demonstrate:
   

  

* Ability to create a stimulating and motivating workplace capable of attracting, engaging, developing, and retaining high performers, ensure coaching and individual development plans for all Supply Chain employees across the network
* Mindset and behaviors consistent with the role of leaders in our organization, characterized as Visionary, Architect, Coach and Catalyst, enable people to develop to their full potential, continuously developing capabilities, skills and mindset.
* Leadership with a growth mindset, high self awareness and acting as a coach and mentor for other Supply Chain leaders and professionals.
* Ability to influence with courageous authenticity and build trust with individuals at all levels in the organization
* Establishment of clear accountabilities, drive empowerment, delegate and foster decision-making within the network
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, ability to work with many different and senior stakeholders and proven ability to effectively lead and enable change
* Excellent situational assessment and objective evaluation skills, with an ability to comprehend and translate complex topics into manageable pieces, to then position the topics with strong communication and group facilitation capabilities
* Ability to leverage technology and data to generate insights as foundation for diagnosis, recommendations and decisions
* Passion and ability to leverage digital tools for collaboration, co-creation and sharing across the system


****Potential locations within the Subregion North-West, where we have a Roche affiliate: Belgium, Denmark, Finland, Netherlands, Norway, Sweden.****
 Who we are
   

  

 At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we’ve become one of the world’s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.
   

  

**Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.**

title: Solution Manager - Security
description:
Bankgirot har en unik ställning på Sveriges betalmarknad som nu genomgår den största transformationen i modern tid. Vår IT-organisation är i en tillväxtfas för att utveckla framtidssäkrade lösningar som följer internationell standard och regelverk. Samtidigt ser vi till att det nuvarande betalsystemet fungerar säkert och stabilt – varje dag.
 



  





 Arbetet med att utveckla framtidens betalinfrastruktur är i full gång och vi behöver dig som vill vara en del av resan. Som Solution Manager kommer du att spela en viktig roll i uppdraget att säkerställa framtidens betalinfrastruktur på ett teknikbolag där vi har ett stort hjärta för uppdraget – och varandra.
 



  





**Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden** 




  





 Rollen som Solution Manager security innebär att:
 


* Säkerställa att lösningar inom ditt tjänsteområde uppfyller de tekniska och säkerhetsmässiga kraven.
* Delta i samarbete med både interna och externa intressenter för att förvalta tjänsteleveransen.
* Ansvara för versioner och konfigurationer, och stödja Service Manager i att säkerställa att tjänsters livscykelhantering följer säkerhetskraven.
* Arbeta nära processorganisationen och tillämpa ITIL-ramverket för att uppfylla krav på lösningar.
* Stödja Service Manager och Vendor Manager i arbetet med SLA, OLA och KPI samt kravställa övervakning och kapacitetsrapportering.
* Bidra med expertis vid tekniska riskanalyser och proaktivt identifiera utvecklingsområden.



  





**Vem är du** 




 Vi söker dig som har ett stort självledarskap och som tar ägarskap för dina frågor. Du är en god kommunikatör med förmåga att möta olika intressenter på olika nivåer, både internt och externt.
 



  





 Du har:
 


* Förmåga att förvalta och utveckla ett komplext IT-säkerhetsarbete.
* Erfarenhet av att genomföra riskbedömningar och utveckla riskhanteringsstrategier.
* Erfarenhet av IT-leveranser baserade på ITIL.
* Tidigare erfarenhet av att tillämpa styrande regelverk för finansiella aktörer.
* Praktisk erfarenhet av att hantera och underhålla IT-infrastruktur, nätverk och kommunikationsprotokoll.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska.
* Relevant utbildning.



  





**Mer information och ansökan** 




 Läs mer om tjänsten och ansök här.
 



 I den här rekryteringen samarbetar Bankgirot med Safemind. Vid frågor kontakta Henrik Gunnarsson, på 0765 664 125, eller henrik.gunnarsson@safemind.se. Urval och intervjuer kommer att ske löpande. Innan anställning beslutas genomförs en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585).
 



  





**Välkommen med din ansökan!** 




  





**Om Bankgirot** 




 Bankgirot är ett svenskt clearinghus och teknikbolag med över 60 års erfarenhet av att leverera finansiell infrastruktur till banker. I samverkan med betalsektorn ser vi till att privatpersoner och företag enkelt kan göra överföringar och betalningar. Bankgirot säkerställer att det nuvarande betalsystemet fungerar felfritt, samtidigt som vi utvecklar framtidssäkrade lösningar. Vi säkrar och utvecklar Sveriges betalningar. Läs mer på www.bankgirot.se

title: Category Manager
description:
Apr 1, 2025
   

  

 Category Manager
   

  

**About Barilla**
 At Barilla, we believe that every great journey begins with passion and a bold vision. From our humble beginnings in 1877 in a small shop in Parma, Italy, we’ve blossomed into a global leader in the food industry, guided by our commitment to progress and excellence.
   

  

 Today, Barilla is an international group present in more than 100 countries and we are proud to be recognized as the world’s top food company by reputation. With 20 beloved brands in our portfolio, we are world leader for pasta, the number one choice for ready-made sauces in Europe, leader for bakery products in Italy, and for crispbread across Scandinavia with Wasa.
   

  

 Our success story is written by a passionate team of 9,000 dedicated employees across 30 plants and offices worldwide, all united by a shared mission to nourish the future with purpose and passion.
   

  

**Are you ready to add your unique flavor to our journey?**
**Job Description**
 Barilla is now looking for a full time Category Associate Manager to join the
 **Category team** 
 based in Stockholm Sweden.
   

  

 As our Category Manager, you will work together both with internal departments such as KAM, Trade, Finance and the Sales Force as well as with external customers as an expert to ensure that Barilla is seen as the preferred category partner, allowing the categories to grow. Furthermore, you will be the focal point of RGM and you will have the capability to influence the commercial teams as the sales navigator. You are comfortable in Nielsen and to Analyze market data at customer and category level. We also work with ICA Self Serve, so a plus if you have previous experience from this area.
   

  

 Key Accountabilities
   

  

**Data Analysis And Management**
* Analysis of data and insights management for shopper and category, converting into business recommendations and market/costumer opportunities.
* Continuously analyse our assortment in order to find opportunities for growth, come up with recommendations for our central customers as well as our sales force in order to drive profitable growth
* Prepare and present customer presentations to central customers


 Shopper and category intelligence
   

  

* Ensure shopper and category intelligence to answer relevant business questions
* Continuously observing/screening shopper/consumer/category trends and insights
* Recommend and execute category and shopper studies and present those to central customers as well as internal stakeholders


 Shelf layout and placement
   

  

 Develop and provide shelf placement guidelines and recommendations for improving shelf performance and product initiatives.
   

  

 Insights sharing and cross-functional collaboration
   

  

* Work closely with sales, trade marketing, category marketing and leverage key insights to drive sales and shares
* Hold engaging presentations of all category findings/analysis internally as well as during our Sales conferences to our Sales force
* Be the sparring partner and addressing queries related to ongoing projects and initiatives


**Desired Skills And Background**
* Great record of accomplishment, with a minimum of 5 years of work experience from category/brand management in the FMCG setting. Any additional experience in Sales and Trade Marketing will be considered a strong advantage
* Previous Experience in managing customer data driven decision making
* Excellent communication skills in Swedish and English
* Expert user of all Microsoft office tools as well as AC Nielsen databases or equivalent.
* Strong people management skills, by driving shared goals, building trust and using an open communication
* Demonstration of leadership and ownership, showing curiosity and creativity, while building strong and trustful relationships
* Project management and analytical skills with a strong “can do” attitude that allows sound decisions making within established guidelines
* International growth mindset, ideally proven with international experiences


 We Offer
   

  

* High Responsibility: From day one, we entrust you with significant responsibilities. Your impact matters, and we recognize it.
* Personal Development: Join us for professional growth and gain global experience in a dynamic international setting, offering extensive exposure and opportunities to excel.
* Continuous Learning: We believe in growth. Expect regular feedback and training opportunities to maximize your potential.
* Flexible Work Arrangements: Embrace our hybrid approach, and flexible working hours.
* Diversity & Inclusion: Engage in national and international projects that champion diversity and inclusion. Your unique perspective matters here.
* Excellent Public Transportation Access: Whether you prefer biking or public transport, we have got you covered. Enjoy working in a stylish, modern office which ensures easy access to various transportation options.
* Motivated Team: Be part of a dynamic and motivated team. We thrive on collaboration, innovation, and mutual support.
* Positive and Inclusive Culture: Experience a workplace where positivity and inclusivity are at the core. Our flat hierarchies encourage open communication and mutual respect.


 Application
   

  

 Candidates will be contacted by our international Recruiter at Talent Solutions, part of ManpowerGroup. Our Recruiter is based in Germany, for this reason, a number with the country code +49 will be used.
   

  

 Applications and CVs are sent via our job portal www.barillacareers.com Join us / Current Job Opportunities. If you have any questions regarding the recruitment process, please get in touch with Talent Acquisition, Kamil Tokarski; kamil.tokarski@external.barilla.com.
   

  

 We are reviewing candidates regularly so do not wait with your application!
   

  

 At Barilla, we are committed to creating an inclusive and equitable workplace where diversity in all its forms is valued and embraced. Our employment policies and practices are designed to ensure equal employment opportunities for all, regardless of age, race, color, citizenship, faith, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, gender identity or characteristics of expression, sexual orientation, marital status, genetic information, medical condition, protected veteran status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by law. Our commitment to equal employment stems from our unwavering belief that it is not only the right thing to do, but it is also a fundamental driver of innovation and business success.
   

  

 Trade Marketing & Sales
   

  

 Sweden
   

  

 Stockholm
   

  

 Permanent

title: Manager, Sales Engineering (Remote)
description:
As a global leader in cybersecurity, CrowdStrike protects the people, processes and technologies that drive modern organizations. Since 2011, our mission hasn’t changed — we’re here to stop breaches, and we’ve redefined modern security with the world’s most advanced AI-native platform. Our customers span all industries, and they count on CrowdStrike to keep their businesses running, their communities safe and their lives moving forward. We’re also a mission-driven company. We cultivate a culture that gives every CrowdStriker both the flexibility and autonomy to own their careers. We’re always looking to add talented CrowdStrikers to the team who have limitless passion, a relentless focus on innovation and a fanatical commitment to our customers, our community and each other. Ready to join a mission that matters? The future of cybersecurity starts with you.
   

  

**About The Role**
 At CrowdStrike, our Pre Sales Engineers provide the technical knowledge, experience and understanding to allow existing and new customers and partners to gain maximum value from our technology, from building world-class Security Operation Centres to acute post-breach response. The Pre Sales Manager leads this team, providing inspiration, guidance, training, development and assistance to drive the business forward.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
 You will be expected to build, develop and retain a strong team in a rapidly growing and evolving company. You’ll undoubtedly be required to recruit new team members to support the company growth, so you will need both a strong industry network and an excellent ability to work hand in hand with our recruitment team. However, you’ll also need to build from within, helping SEs in your team raise and refine their skills, implementing training programs and mentoring across the team.
   

  

 Your partners will be the Regional Directors of Sales for Nordics. You will need to be joined at the hip, planning and executing together on a shared vision. In region you’ll also be partnered with a number of Marketing, Channel and other leaders, each with their own needs. To succeed, you will need to have a set of open, transparent relationships, building on mutual trust with each of these functions.
   

  

 Building wider relationships is also going to be key; Pre Sales can’t operate without the Post Sales team, so you will also be working with the Technical Account Management and Support Managers to ensure a great handover of existing accounts and ongoing management. You will need to have an open dialogue with your peers in our Reseller Partners, SIs, MSSPs, Store Partners and Technical Partners (3rd party vendors etc). Finally, you’ll provide input back to the Product Management, Product Marketing Management and CTO team on future product and service developments your team discovers in the field, especially competitive intelligence.
   

  

 The technical, commercial, communication and negotiation skills needed to accomplish team goals won’t always be provided by others. While you will spend a lot of time coaching, you will also need to directly involve yourself in the most complex and valuable opportunities. To do this well you will need to bring industry knowledge and experience and the ability and willingness to do the job of a Pre Sales Engineer from time to time. In short, sometimes you just roll up your sleeves and get stuck in.
   

  

 In addition, you will work alongside Marketing and have opportunities to present at industry conferences and marketing events, promoting the CrowdStrike brand and technology as well as your own capabilities.
   

  

**What You'll Need**
* Pre-sales/technical experience within networking and/or security
* Planning and organisational skills
* Ability to influence departmental management teams
* Proven problem solving skills
* Experience in working with channel partners
* Experience working in an IT security business
* Familiarity with various hacking and exploitation tools and methodologies, common malware families, and Anti-Virus / IDS / IPS evasion techniques
* Leadership skills with the ability to prioritize and execute in a methodical and disciplined manner. Set and manage expectations with senior stake-holders and team members
* Excellent communication and presentation skills with the ability to present to a variety of external audiences, including being able to interact with senior executives
* A willingness to be challenged and a strong desire to learn
* Must be prepared to travel to client meetings where necessary
* Line management experience, including managing teams remotely
* Security certifications, CISSP, CISM, Security+, CEH, etc


**Benefits Of Working At CrowdStrike**
* Remote-friendly and flexible work culture
* Market leader in compensation and equity awards
* Comprehensive physical and mental wellness programs
* Competitive vacation and holidays for recharge
* Paid parental and adoption leaves
* Professional development opportunities for all employees regardless of level or role
* Employee Resource Groups, geographic neighbourhood groups and volunteer opportunities to build connections
* Vibrant office culture with world class amenities
* Great Place to Work Certified™ across the globe


 CrowdStrike is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fostering a culture of belonging where everyone is valued for who they are and empowered to succeed. We support veterans and individuals with disabilities through our affirmative action program.
   

  

 CrowdStrike is committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all employees and applicants for employment. The Company does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, creed, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy or pregnancy-related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or family status, veteran status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical disability (including HIV and AIDS), mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, membership or activity in a local human rights commission, status with regard to public assistance, or any other characteristic protected by law. We base all employment decisions--including recruitment, selection, training, compensation, benefits, discipline, promotions, transfers, lay-offs, return from lay-off, terminations and social/recreational programs--on valid job requirements.
   

  

 If you need assistance accessing or reviewing the information on this website or need help submitting an application for employment or requesting an accommodation, please contact us at recruiting@crowdstrike.com for further assistance.

title: Head of Communication for Business Area Generation
emails: sofia.mankert@vattenfall.com, johanna.kollander@vattenfall.com, rolf.olsson@vattenfall.com, christer.gustafsson2@vattenfall.com, juha.siipilehto@vattenfall.com, anders.bohlin@vattenfall.com
description:
Om tjänsten
   

  

 Role overview
   

  

 As Head of Communications for Business Area Generation, you will report to the Vice President Business & Corporate Communication and work closely with the Senior Vice President of Business Area Generation. You will be a key member of both the Business & Corporate Communication management team and the Business Area Generation management team, shaping and executing strategic communication efforts across the company.
   

  

 Our Staff Function Communication supports Vattenfall’s business strategy across all markets and stakeholders. We collaborate closely with Business Areas and Staff Functions, to empower employees and support business objectives Within Communications this work is carried out in close collaboration between the Brand, Media Relations, Public & Regulatory Affairs, and Business & Corporate Communication teams. As a business-driven communication function, we understand our industry, stakeholders, and market dynamics. We proactively identify opportunities and challenges, developing strategies that leverage our unique position to drive progress. Our purpose—enabling the fossil-free future that drives society forward—guides everything we do.
   

  

 Main Responsibilities
   

  

* Develop and execute a communication plan for BA Generation in collaboration with the Business Area and communication experts from Media Relations, Brand, Public & Regulatory Affairs, and Project Management teams.
* Act as a strategic advisor to the Senior Vice President and the BA Generation management team, providing both high-level counsel and hands-on support on all internal and external communication matters.
* Plan and execute communication projects and activities to support BA Generation’s business objectives:
* Internal communication: Enhance employee engagement and understanding of the business strategy and support transformation of BA Generation. Develop and implement internal communication formats and drive change communication.
* External communication: Build awareness and understanding of BA Generation’s strategy, support business goals, and contribute to shaping favorable business and regulatory frameworks. Navigate a complex stakeholder and media landscape.
* Contribute to group-wide communication projects, ensuring a consistent and integrated Vattenfall narrative.
* Manage functional communication teams across various internal and external projects, working with colleagues in five markets in an international setting.
* Oversee resources, budgeting, and performance tracking to ensure efficient and impactful communication, as well as streamlined and simplified ways of working.


 Din bakgrund
   

  

 Desired education and experience:
   

  

* University degree in Communications, Political Science, Business, or another relevant topic.
* Extensive experience (min. 7 years) in both internal and external communication, including experience in a managerial position.
* Experience working in an international environment across several markets. Ideally, experience with different disciplines of communication.


 We believe that the following strengths and skills will help you be successful in this role:
   

  

 Communication skills: You are a strong communicator with the ability to translate business needs into clear, engaging, and effective communication strategies, stories and activities. You know how to identify and engage target audiences in meaningful and creative ways, ensuring that key messages resonate.
   

  

 Team player & independent worker: You have strong interpersonal skills and know how to engage and lead teams toward shared goals. You are also independent and self-driven, capable of setting clear objectives and working towards them with focus and determination.
   

  

 Strategic & hands-on: You can seamlessly shift between high-level strategic thinking and hands-on execution. You understand and address complex business and communication needs in a structured and strategic manner while also being able to roll up your sleeves and deliver results under tight deadlines.
   

  

 Curious & innovative: You are eager to explore new and creative ways to communicate, staying ahead of trends and technologies. With a strong interest in society, you quickly adapt and experiment with innovative approaches to ensure effective and impactful communication.
   

  

 Language: You need to be fluent in English language (written and verbal) and in Swedish.
   

  

 Mer information
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

 We offer a fun and challenging role at the core of one of society’s most important challenges. You will have the opportunity to shape and drive communication in an area that truly makes a difference. In this role, you will have a high degree of independence while being part of a collaborative and supportive culture. You will work alongside passionate colleagues in an environment that values innovation, creativity, strategic thinking and impact.
   

  

 Location: Stockholm.
   

  

 For more information about the position you are welcome to contact hiring manager Sofia Mankert sofia.mankert@vattenfall.com. For more information about the recruitment process you are welcome to contact Johanna Kollander johanna.kollander@vattenfall.com.
   

  

 Trade union representatives in Sweden  Rolf Olsson rolf.olsson@vattenfall.com
   

  

 Akademikerna, Christer Gustafsson christer.gustafsson2@vattenfall.com
   

  

 Ledarna, Juha Siipilehto juha.siipilehto@vattenfall.com
   

  

 SEKO, Anders Bohlin anders.bohlin@vattenfall.com Unionen
   

  

 To get in contact with the representatives, please call Vattenfall´s switchboard +46 8 739 50 00.
   

  

 We welcome your application including CV and cover through the portal, last day to apply 6 april .Selection and interviews are held after last application date. We do not accept applications through email.
   

  

  

  

 As Vattenfall is part of the Swedish critical infrastructure many of our positions are security classed. If this position is security classed the final candidates can be subject to a security vetting process, according to the Swedish legislation.
   

  

 Om oss
   

  

 Do you want to work where change is happening and be part of shaping the future? Join our journey towards Fossil Freedom!
   

  

 We are looking for an senior and strategic communicator to join us as Head of Communications for Business Area Generation. In this role, you will translate the complex context in which Vattenfall and BA Generation operate into tangible communication strategies and actions. This is an exciting opportunity to drive high-impact communication in a dynamic industry at the forefront of the energy transition. If you are a strategic thinker with a hands-on approach and a passion for engaging communication, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

 Vattenfall is one of Europe’s largest energy companies, with a clear purpose to build a future where everyone can choose fossil free ways to move, make and live. BA Generation works to meet tomorrow’s demand for fossil free electricity when it’s most needed. One half of all energy in Sweden’s electricity system is produced by the nuclear and hydro power plants operated by BA Generation. In the German energy system, our pumped hydropower plants deliver fossil free ancillary services that help stabilize the grid.

title: (Senior) IT Consultant - Principal Investors and Private Equity | BCG Platinion
description:
Who We Are
   

  

 Do you want to turn the challenges of digitalization into the solutions of the future? Join BCG Platinion in tackling the core IT issues of leading global companies. Deploy customized platforms, architectures, strategies, and organizations to leverage the digital potential of our customers and drive true innovation, with state-of-the-art tools such as cloud computing, AI, blockchain, microservices, and containerization. Add your individual strengths to our unique team, always there to support you. Together with Boston Consulting Group and our clients, we turn digital visions into reality.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

 More so than ever, technology is driving business growth and must therefore be a top consideration in M&A decision making. Assessing technological capabilities in the due diligence phase requires knowledge across IT architecture, enterprise systems and cybersecurity – we are looking for passionate talent! As a (Senior) IT Consultant for our PIPE (Principal Investors & Private Equity) practice area, you will be focused on helping the world’s largest private equity firms address their strategic technology challenges, whether they are buying or selling a business. We look for new colleagues in our offices in Stockholm, Helsinki, Oslo, and Copenhagen!
   

  

 What You'll Bring
   

  

**You can help us make a difference if you**
 ▪ bring multiple years of experience in IT strategy and consulting, professional software development or IT project management in a tech related corporate development or start-up
   

  

 ▪ gathered basic understanding of technology financials and how it impacts deal value
   

  

 ▪ are familiar with working within a Merger and Acquisition (M&A) environment, with a focus upon technology due diligence, technology carve-out, technology PMI or PE-related value creation initiative with a portfolio company
   

  

 ▪ are a strategic thinker who likes to work creatively and analytically in an environment focused on exceptional problem-solving
   

  

 ▪ bring stellar analytical and conceptual skills, strong customer focus and mental agility with a result-orientation
   

  

 ▪ obtained a university degree with above average academic performance in a STEM related field or business management
   

  

 Who You'll Work With
   

  

**Shape the world of tomorrow**
 ▪ You will drive groundbreaking projects by using agile methods and modern approaches within the scope of strategic IT implementation for clients and by actively steering the relevant modules
   

  

 ▪ You will smooth the path for tailored, future-oriented customer journeys based on precise analysis of the situation and with current market developments and trends, such as machine learning, in mind
   

  

 ▪ You will design and optimize unique IT architectures within the framework of enterprise solution requirements, modern custom software developments, and sustainable digital solutions, including cyber resilience
   

  

 Additional info
   

  

**How You Can Grow With Us**
 We guarantee constant development incentives in an open and rewarding work environment! Together with a dedicated team of top talents, you get to work on new challenges every day. Individual training offers and a culture of open feedback will provide the framework needed to explore and perfect personal strengths. Our modern structures allow focusing on the essence of our work - with easy travel booking, an excellent back-office support and comprehensive Knowledge Center. With our regular office Fridays and legendary events, we cultivate a strong and close team network beyond our case work.
   

  

*BCG Platinion is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable.*
*#BCGPlatinion*
 Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.
   

  

 BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

title: Senior Manager - Oral B
description:
**Job Location**
 Stockholm
   

  

**Job Description**
 Ever wondered how a brand like Oral-B becomes the #1 brand recommended by dentists worldwide? Do you want to be a part of a global brand’s mission to continue to be the world’s most influential?
   

  

 We have an amazing opportunity to join Nordic organisation as a
 **Senior Manager** 
 to lead the team’s mission of influencing dental professionals to drive the usage and recommendation of Oral-B products!
   

  

**What to Expect:**
 Oral-B has an impressive reputation for the development of innovative, market leading oral health care products which consistently delight the consumer and challenge current thinking. Our goal is to fuel a strong team, identify opportunities, and deliver key results for the Professional Oral Health business through external influencing, strategic analysis, and planning. As part of this role, you will lead our team of territory managers and be the leader who delivers strong multi-functional team partnership, in close collaboration with Nordic Category Leader.
   

  

**Key responsibilities:**
**Team leader:**
* Conduct Field Visits: spend 2 days per week in the field coaching territory managers by identifying areas for development and building on strengths as it relates to the strategic influencing process.
* Demonstrating with customers to develop skills in the team or delivering role play to facilitate capability of the territory managers.
* Provide input on and deliver training programs to team to effectively build strategic influencing process skills and the level of technical product knowledge needed to drive professional usage & recommendations.


**Business Management and Operations**
* Coach individual territory managers on execution of business plans and their personal development including annual performance reviews and salary management.
* Prepare and co-lead monthly business reviews.


**Strategic analysis and planning**
* Collaborate with multi-functional teams, providing field inputs and insights on dental business plan priority projects and initiatives.
* Analyse insights and propose recommendations to improve operations execution, work closely with Category Leader and multi-functional team to update Professional Oral Health Strategy and focus areas.


**What We Offer You**
* Responsibilities as of Day 1 – you will feel the ownership from the beginning, you will be given specific projects and responsibilities, and experience the impact you can have on our business early on.
* Continuous coaching – you will work with passionate people and receive both formal training as well as day-to-day mentoring from your manager.
* Supportive Work Environment - Employees are at the core; we value every individual and promote agility and work/life balance. We will provide you with opportunities in which you will be expected to grow and develop yourself as well as others.
* Compensation and Benefits - P&G take a Total Rewards approach therefore on top of your competitive salary you can expect a whole range of benefits such as: company car, pension, private health insurance, stock ownership scheme, and other social benefits. We also provide annual salary revisions and possible promotions - all in line with your results, performance, and potential.


**Job Qualifications**
**What We Look For:**
* A team leader with previous experience(s) of people management and operations responsibilities.
* Strong analytical and communication skills: analyse data sets, identify trends, articulate business insights clearly, and turn them into recommendations/actions.
* Executional excellence: successful track record of delivering with excellence complex projects.
* Forward thinker who can quickly adapt to new cultures/systems.
* Fluent oral and written language skills in one of the Nordic languages and English.
* Valid driver’s license.
* Above all a passion for winning! We aim to recruit smart individuals who get things done and stand out from the crowd. All qualifications are desirable but not strictly necessary in combination, as we want to provide opportunities for growth and development and welcome applications from different industries.


**At P&G #weseeequal**
 We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. At P&G we strive to build a culture where everyone feels welcome, included, and able to bring their full selves to work.
   

  

 We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process. Please click here if you require an accommodation during the application process. Please make sure to wait to hear back from us regarding your accommodation
 **before** 
 proceeding with the online assessment, we thank you in advance for your patience.
   

  

**Job Schedule**
 Full time
   

  

**Job Number**
 R000125455
   

  

**Job Segmentation**
 Experienced Professionals (Job Segmentation)Starting Pay / Salary Range

title: EV Business Development Director - Sweden
description:
**ABOUT ZENOBE**
